snippet: Franklin Reyes, accused of striking a 4-year-old girl last year while fleeing the police on the Upper West Side, had his bail increased to $50,000 because he was charged with petty larceny in July.
abstract: Franklin Reyes, unlicensed teenage driver who fatally struck 4-year-old Ariel Russo in 2013 while fleeing police on Upper West Side, is taken into custody; Reyes's bail has been doubled to $50,000 because he was charged with petty larceny in July.
lead_paragraph: Franklin Reyes, accused of striking a 4-year-old girl last year while fleeing the police on the Upper West Side, had his bail increased to $50,000 because he was charged with petty larceny in July.

headline.main: After a Separate Arrest, Bail Is Doubled for Teenage Driver in Fatal Accident
headline.print_headline: Bail Increase for Driver in Fatal ’13 Crash
